sen.j: 今井 信郎（いまい のぶお、天保12年10月2日 (旧暦)（1841年11月14日） - 大正8年（1919年）6月25日）は、幕末から明治時代初期に活躍した武士である。
sen.e: Nobuo IMAI (November 14, 1841 - June 25, 1919) was a samurai flourished from the closing days of the Tokugawa shogunte to early in the Meiji period.
Nobuo IMAI (November 14, 1841 - June 25, 1919) was a samurai who flourished from the closing days of the Tokugawa shogunte to early in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Nobuo IMAI (November 14, 1841 - June 25, 1919) was a samurai who lived around the end of the Tokugawa shogunate to the early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 徳川方に着き、京都見廻組に参加しており、近江屋事件で暗躍したとされている。
sen.e: He took the Tokugawa side, served as a member of the Kyoto Mimawarigumi (Tokugawa clan sided faction), and operated behind the scenes of the Omiya Incident.
He took the Tokugawa side, served as a member of the Kyoto Mimawarigumi (Tokugawa clan sided faction), and operated behind the scenes of the Omiya Incident.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was on the Tokugawa side as a member of the Kyoto Mimawarigumi (Tokugawa clan sided faction) and is said to have operated behind the scenes of the Omiya Incident.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 講武所の柔術師範だった窪田鎮勝から扱心流を習い、榊原鍵吉から直心影流剣術を習った。
sen.e: Nobuo IMAI learned the Kyushinryu school Jujutsu (classical Japanese martial art, usually referring to fighting without a weapon) from Shigekatsu KUBOTA (taught Jujutsu at Kobusho (shogunate martial arts gymnasium)) and learned the Jikishinkage-ryu school swordsmanship from Kenkichi SAKAKIBARA (taught swordsmanship at Kobusho).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.e: Nobuo IMAI learned the Kyushin school of Jujutsu (classical Japanese martial art, usually referred to as fighting without a weapon) from Jujutsu master Shigekatsu KUBOTA, and learned the Jikishinkage school of swordsmanship from Kenkichi SAKAKIBARA at the Kobusho (shogunate martial arts gymnasium).

sen.j: 講武所の剣術師範代を勤めた。
sen.e: He served as an assistant instructor of swordsmanship at Kobusho.

sen.e: He served as an assistant instructor of swordsmanship at Kobusho.

sen.j: 遊撃隊頭取として京都に赴き、上京後、佐々木只三郎の京都見廻組に参加した。
sen.e: Nobuo IMAI entered Kyoto as the head of Yugekitai, and joined the Kyoto Mimawarigumi under the command of Tadasaburo SASAKI.
Nobuo IMAI entered Kyoto as the head of Yugekitai, and joined the Kyoto Mimawarigumi under the command of Tadasaburo SASAKI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Nobuo IMAI went to Kyoto as the head of the Yugekitai (one of Tokugawa clan sided units) and joined the Kyoto Mimawarigumi, which was under the command of Tadasaburo SASAKI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: イギリスの「歩兵操練・図解」を翻訳し、江戸幕府の洋式歩兵部隊の編成を窪田鎮章（窪田鎮勝の子）と進めていた古屋佐久左衛門は、衝鋒隊（鳥羽伏見の戦いで戦死した佐久間近江守の第11連隊と、やはり戦死した窪田鎮章の第12連隊の残存兵力を結集）を組織した。
sen.e: Sakuzaemon FURUYA who had translated "Hohei soren and zukai (the Infantry Training Manual and Illustrations)" and managed to organize Western-style infantry for the Edo shogunate with Shigeaki KUBOTA (son of Shigekatsu KUBOTA).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sakuzaemon FURUYA, who had translated "Hohei soren and zukai (the Infantry Training Manual and Illustrations)" and managed to organize Western-style infantry for the Edo shogunate with Shigeaki KUBOTA (son of Shigekatsu KUBOTA).
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Sakuzaemon FURUYA, who had translated "Hohei soren and zukai" (the Infantry Training Manual and Illustrations) and was trying to establish a Western-style infantry for the Edo shogunate, formed the Shohotai together with Shigeaki KUBOTA (son of Shigekatsu KUBOTA) by joining the surviving forces of the eleventh regiment under the command of Sakuma, governor of Omi Province, who had been killed in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, and the twelfth regiment under the command of Shigeaki KUBOTA, who had also been killed in war.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 今井信郎はその副隊長になり、戊辰戦争を箱館まで戦い抜いた。
sen.e: Sakuzaemon FURUYA formed Shohotai by joining surviving forces of the eleventh regiment under the command of Sakuma, the governor of Omi Province, who had been killled in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, and the twelfth regiment under the command of Shigeaki KUBOTA, who had also been killed in war.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Nobuo IMAI became the deputy leader of this Shohotai and fought in the Boshin War until to the Battle of Hakodate.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 明治3年、箱館で降伏。
sen.e: In Meiji 3, he surrenderd in Hakodate.
In the 3rd year of the Meiji era, he surrenderd in Hakodate.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: He surrendered in Hakodate in 1870.
sen.cmt: FB修正を反映の上、重複していたin 1870 を一つ削除しました。

sen.j: 今井信郎は、近江屋事件での坂本龍馬暗殺の犯人は、自分であると証言する。
sen.e: Nobuo IMAI stated that it was he who assassinated Ryouma SAKAMOTO in the Omiya Incident.
Nobuo IMAI stated that it was he who assassinated Ryouma SAKAMOTO in the Omiya Incident.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Nobuo IMAI stated that it was he who assassinated Ryoma SAKAMOTO in the Omiya Incident.
sen.cmt: Ryoma としました。

sen.j: また明治時代初期に今井は坂本龍馬を殺したとして、官軍（薩摩軍）により逮捕され投獄された。
sen.e: Early in the Meiji period, IMAI was arrested and jailed by the Imperial army (Satsuma army) for killing Ryouma SAKAMOTO.
Early in the Meiji period, IMAI was arrested and jailed by the Imperial army (Satsuma army) for killing Ryouma SAKAMOTO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: IMAI was arrested and jailed by the Imperial army (Satsuma army) for killing Ryoma SAKAMOTO in the early Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: しかし西郷隆盛の働きかけで処刑されることなく釈放される。
sen.e: As a result of Takamori SAIGO's approach, Nobuo IMAI was released without executed.
As a result of Takamori SAIGO's approach, Nobuo IMAI was released without being executed.

sen.e: As a result of Takamori SAIGO's intervention, Nobuo IMAI was released without being executed.

sen.j: 西南戦争がおきるとかつての部下を集めて九州に向かった。

sen.j: 官軍の支援に行くのではなく、助命嘆願してくれた西郷を助けに行くのが目的だったという。
